name: Blog post layout
title: Blog post layout

files.name: components/blog-post.tsx
app/globals.css
app/page.tsx
files.content:
import { BlogPost } from "@/components/blog-post" // Example rendered markdown content const exampleContent = `

Hearts of Iron IV

Naval AI Crisis

The community has raised significant concerns about the naval combat AI, particularly in multiplayer scenarios. Players report that the AI fleets often make poor strategic decisions.

  • AI refuses to engage in favorable matchups
  • Fleet positioning problems in the Mediterranean
  • Carrier strike groups operating ineffectively

The naval AI has been broken for three patches now. It's honestly unplayable in competitive multiplayer.

Victoria 3

DLC Quality Concerns

Recent DLC releases have sparked debate within the community about value proposition and feature completeness. Many players feel that core mechanics should have been included in the base game.

  • Pricing perceived as excessive for content delivered
  • Features feel like they should be free updates
  • Community mod scene more innovative than official content

I love Paradox games, but this DLC strategy is pushing away long-time fans. We deserve better.

` export default function Page() { return }

messages.content:
You're styling a blog post layout for gaming industry sentiment reports.
The content is markdown-rendered HTML with:
- H2 section headers (game names like "Hearts of Iron IV", "Victoria 3")
- H3 subheaders (topics like "Naval AI Crisis", "DLC Quality Concerns")
- Bullet point lists
- Blockquotes (community quotes)
- Horizontal rules between sections

The component receives: title, date, contentHtml (rendered markdown string).
Use Tailwind CSS. Make it visually engaging and clear, not flat.


Design direction: EDITORIAL/MAGAZINE
- Think The Verge or Polygon article layout
- Bold typography choices - large section headers
- Accent color highlights (pick a tasteful blue or teal)
- Pull quotes with dramatic styling (large, italic, colored border)
- Generous whitespace, feels premium and readable
- Maybe subtle background gradients or section dividers

files.source:
import { BlogPost } from "@/components/blog-post" // Example rendered markdown content const exampleContent = `

Hearts of Iron IV

Naval AI Crisis

The community has raised significant concerns about the naval combat AI, particularly in multiplayer scenarios. Players report that the AI fleets often make poor strategic decisions.

  • AI refuses to engage in favorable matchups
  • Fleet positioning problems in the Mediterranean
  • Carrier strike groups operating ineffectively

The naval AI has been broken for three patches now. It's honestly unplayable in competitive multiplayer.

Victoria 3

DLC Quality Concerns

Recent DLC releases have sparked debate within the community about value proposition and feature completeness. Many players feel that core mechanics should have been included in the base game.

  • Pricing perceived as excessive for content delivered
  • Features feel like they should be free updates
  • Community mod scene more innovative than official content

I love Paradox games, but this DLC strategy is pushing away long-time fans. We deserve better.

` export default function Page() { return }

The design uses generous whitespace and a subtle background gradient for that magazine-quality feel.
